channel.title: A few questions
channel.description:
ok, so when you logg in you start at the dummys in varrock, i want it to start in lummy, wich file would i need to change this?
also i dont want the dummys to give exp, i want ppl to train on npc's, how do i stop the dummys giving exp?
ThankYou in advance if you help
Using R Xscape
<33

item.title: A few questions

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Xizl_Halton_Xizl:

weres client.java in the 508 files?

There isn’t one. You could have mentioned you were using a 508 source in your question, so we wouldn’t waste our time posting 317 code. To me, it looks like you should start on 317-377 before moving onto 503+…

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Player.java for changing the starting coords

search for

initial

and for the second question

search client.java for the Dummy ID.

Should come up with something like

case ####: Blah(blah, blah); break;

Delete it or remove what is inside the case.

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

well i can give you this code for the command ::mypos. Its for delta so idk if it will work for you. Other than that most coords can be found in emote tab or if its silab right click something
code for mypos

if(command.startsWith("mypos") && playerRights > 0){ sM("AbsX: "+absX+" AbsY: "+absY+""); } simple code that makes life easier

Read full topic

item.title: A few questions
item.dc:creator: @grimreaper61 grimreaper61
item.description:
@grimreaper61 wrote:

Ok i never used it but i can try to help. To change where they start off open client.java search for this character file not found should take you to some code that has x and y coords for if its a new file. Then for your second part, find out how much xp you get for dummies then if its attack do addExp however much it is searching through client i am guessing.(its in client for mine). Then you can set it to 0 or delete it. (again dont know anything about rxscape, just trying to help).

Read full topic
